messages.title: A better Plan A better Future for South Derbyshire

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improvements to transport and employment, cuts in off-peak bus services have made it more difficult for shift workers to get to work.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS with Time to Care
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue to campaign strongly to keep the NHS in public hands. Ensure two hospitals in Burton and Derby are better supported and that local GP's are better supported to reduce overwhelming workloads.
More quality jobs with no too many part-time, low wage jobs and people on zero hours contracts, introduction of 25 hours free childcare for 3-4 year olds and provision of the living wage.

issues.economy: Need more quality jobs with decent security, fewer low wage, zero hours contracts, and provision of the living wage.
issues.education: Introduction of 25 hours free childcare for 3-4 year olds.
issues.health: Keep the NHS public, support hospitals in Burton and Derby, support local GPs.

leaflet.personalStatement: My personal pledges to you: To be your full time MP with only one job, which is to serve South Derbyshire. To have accessible weekly surgeries across all parts of the constituency. To hold regular listening events focused on the key issues for our area. To not take a pay increase in the next term of Parliament. To be honest and transparent in all my activities and keep my expenses to a minimum.

contactInformation.address: MS Martine A Allard The Old Post Office Main Street Swadlincote Derbyshire DE12 8EG

images.caption: Cheryl Pidgeon with supporters holding signs 'SOS NHS'
